segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 12
segments.en: Linked Discourses 12

segments.pli: 3. Dasabalavagga
segments.en: 3. The Ten Powers

segments.pli: 22. Dutiyadasabalasutta
segments.en: 22. The Ten Powers (2nd)

segments.pli: Sāvatthiyaṃ viharati.
segments.en: At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: “Dasabalasamannāgato, bhikkhave, tathāgato catūhi ca vesārajjehi samannāgato āsabhaṃ ṭhānaṃ paṭijānāti, parisāsu sīhanādaṃ nadati, brahmacakkaṃ pavatteti:
segments.en: “Mendicants, a Realized One has ten powers and four kinds of self-assurance. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the holy wheel.

segments.pli: ‘iti rūpaṃ iti rūpassa samudayo iti rūpassa atthaṅgamo,
segments.en: Such is form, such is the origin of form, such is the ending of form.

segments.pli: iti vedanā iti vedanāya samudayo iti vedanāya atthaṅgamo,
segments.en: Such is feeling, such is the origin of feeling, such is the ending of feeling.

segments.pli: iti saññā iti saññāya samudayo iti saññāya atthaṅgamo,
segments.en: Such is perception, such is the origin of perception, such is the ending of perception.

segments.pli: iti saṅkhārā iti saṅkhārānaṃ samudayo iti saṅkhārānaṃ atthaṅgamo,
segments.en: Such are choices, such is the origin of choices, such is the ending of choices.

segments.pli: iti viññāṇaṃ iti viññāṇassa samudayo iti viññāṇassa atthaṅgamo.
segments.en: Such is consciousness, such is the origin of consciousness, such is the ending of consciousness.

segments.pli: Iti imasmiṃ sati idaṃ hoti, imassuppādā idaṃ uppajjati;
segments.en: When this exists, that is; due to the arising of this, that arises.

segments.pli: imasmiṃ asati idaṃ na hoti imassa nirodhā idaṃ nirujjhati.
segments.en: When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:

segments.pli: Yadidaṃ avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā;
segments.en: Ignorance is a condition for choices.

segments.pli: saṅkhārapaccayā viññāṇaṃ … pe …
segments.en: Choices are a condition for consciousness. …

segments.pli: evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa samudayo hoti.
segments.en: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.

segments.pli: Avijjāya tveva asesavirāganirodhā saṅkhāranirodho;
segments.en: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.

segments.pli: saṅkhāranirodhā viññāṇanirodho … pe …
segments.en: When choices cease, consciousness ceases. …

segments.pli: evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa nirodho hoti’.
segments.en: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.

segments.pli: Evaṃ svākkhāto, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo uttāno vivaṭo pakāsito chinnapilotiko.
segments.en: So the teaching has been well explained by me, made clear, opened, illuminated, and stripped of patchwork.

segments.pli: Evaṃ svākkhāte kho, bhikkhave, mayā dhamme uttāne vivaṭe pakāsite chinnapilotike alameva saddhāpabbajitena kulaputtena vīriyaṃ ārabhituṃ:
segments.en: Just this much is quite enough for someone who has gone forth out of faith from a good family to rouse up their energy.

segments.pli: ‘kāmaṃ taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upassussatu maṃsalohitaṃ. Yaṃ taṃ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṃ, na taṃ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa saṇṭhānaṃ bhavissatī’ti.
segments.en: ‘Gladly, let only skin, sinews, and tendons remain! Let the flesh and blood waste away in my body! I will not stop trying until I have achieved what is possible by manly strength, energy, and vigor.’

segments.pli: Dukkhaṃ, bhikkhave, kusīto viharati vokiṇṇo pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañca sadatthaṃ parihāpeti.
segments.en: A lazy person lives in suffering, mixed up with bad, unskillful qualities, and ruins a great deal of their own good.

segments.pli: Āraddhavīriyo ca kho, bhikkhave, sukhaṃ viharati pavivitto pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañca sadatthaṃ paripūreti.
segments.en: An energetic person lives happily, secluded from bad, unskillful qualities, and fulfills a great deal of their own good.

segments.pli: Na, bhikkhave, hīnena aggassa patti hoti.
segments.en: The best isn’t reached by the worst.

segments.pli: Aggena ca kho, bhikkhave, aggassa patti hoti.
segments.en: The best is reached by the best.

segments.pli: Maṇḍapeyyamidaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ, satthā sammukhībhūto.
segments.en: This spiritual life is the cream, mendicants, and the Teacher is before you.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, vīriyaṃ ārabhatha appattassa pattiyā, anadhigatassa adhigamāya, asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
segments.en: So you should rouse up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized, thinking:

segments.pli: ‘Evaṃ no ayaṃ amhākaṃ pabbajjā avañjhā bhavissati saphalā saudrayā.
segments.en: ‘In this way our going forth will not be wasted, but will be fruitful and fertile.

segments.pli: Yesañca mayaṃ paribhuñjāma cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhāraṃ tesaṃ te kārā amhesu mahapphalā bhavissanti mahānisaṃsā’ti—
segments.en: And our use of robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick shall be of great fruit and benefit for those who offered them.’

segments.pli: evañhi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabbaṃ.
segments.en: That’s how you should train.

segments.pli: Attatthaṃ vā hi, bhikkhave, sampassamānena alameva appamādena sampādetuṃ;
segments.en: Considering your own good, mendicants, is quite enough for you to persist with diligence.

segments.pli: paratthaṃ vā hi, bhikkhave, sampassamānena alameva appamādena sampādetuṃ;
segments.en: Considering the good of others is quite enough for you to persist with diligence.

segments.pli: ubhayatthaṃ vā hi, bhikkhave, sampassamānena alameva appamādena sampādetun”ti.
segments.en: Considering the good of both is quite enough for you to persist with diligence.”

segments.pli: Dutiyaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha’s teaching rests on his possession of ten powers and four grounds for self-confidence. When hearing such an open teaching, a mendicant puts forth great effort, considering the good for both themselves and for others.
